defs.docs:
This crate provides a configuration loader in the style of the [ruby dotenv
 gem](https://github.com/bkeepers/dotenv). This library is meant to be used
 on development or testing environments in which setting environment
 variables is not practical. It loads environment variables from a .env
 file, if available, and mashes those with the actual environment variables
 provided by the operating system.

attributes.value: / This crate provides a configuration loader in the style of the [ruby dotenv

/ file, if available, and mashes those with the actual environment variables

defs.name: Error
defs.value:
pub enum Error {
    LineParse(String, usize),
    Io(io::Error),
    EnvVar(std::env::VarError),

    #[doc(hidden)]
    __Nonexhaustive,
}

defs.name: var
defs.docs: After loading the dotenv file, fetches the environment variable key from the current process.

attributes.value: / After loading the dotenv file, fetches the environment variable key from the current process.
/ The returned result is Ok(s) if the environment variable is present and is valid unicode. If the
/ environment variable is not present, or it is not valid unicode, then Err will be returned.

defs.name: vars
defs.docs:
After loading the dotenv file, returns an iterator of (variable, value) pairs of strings,
 for all the environment variables of the current process.

attributes.value: / After loading the dotenv file, returns an iterator of (variable, value) pairs of strings,
/ for all the environment variables of the current process.
/ The returned iterator contains a snapshot of the process's environment variables at the
/ time of this invocation, modifications to environment variables afterwards will not be

defs.name: from_path
defs.docs: Loads the file at the specified absolute path.

attributes.value: / Loads the file at the specified absolute path.

defs.name: from_path_iter
defs.docs: Like `from_path`, but returns an iterator over variables instead of loading into environment.

attributes.value: / Like `from_path`, but returns an iterator over variables instead of loading into environment.

deprecated(since = "0.14.1", note =
             "please use `from_path` in conjunction with `var` instead")

defs.name: from_filename
defs.docs: Loads the specified file from the environment's current directory or its parents in sequence.

defs.name: dotenv
defs.docs:
This is usually what you want.
 It loads the .env file located in the environment's current directory or its parents in sequence.
